从前，我养了一只猫，我有十块钱，会用八块钱给它买吃的，经常给它洗澡，它也很粘我。

后来，我带它出去玩，路人觉得它很可爱，他们给它喂猫粮，火腿肠，我很不开心，因为它是我的。我想把它抱回家，可是它挣脱我，冲着给它好吃的人喵喵，我抱了几次他都不跟我走，还挠伤了我，于是我转身就走了.....

后来，偶然在路上遇到了它，它身上脏兮兮的。路人们只会给它好吃的，陪它玩玩，却不会带它回家，给它洗澡。它看到我后就跟着我回家，我把它关在了门外，它在门外喵喵地叫着，叫的我很难受，
可是我不会再要它了

Player since OW 1 launch here. 

I think Blizzard has a ton of issues that are still unresolved especially in upper management even without mentioning the criminals. I do not think it is fair to harass and punish the hard working developers who clearly care about this game more than their leaders.
This game has it's issues. Monetization especially being bad. But I truly love it, game play transitioning into OW2 has been incredible I love everything about actually playing this game. Give it a shot, play some games with your friends, have some fun. YES, the in-game purchases are predatory in their pricing and YES I hate it too. But don't let stuff you don't even need to look at distract you from how good this game can be when you actually play it.

*NOT AN OW BAD NARRATIVE REVIEW* Actual game time around 2000+ hours. 
I wanted to leave a review for a game that, in my opinion, is currently cool to hate. Whether it's OW1 people mad about changes or people who hate Blizzard for one reason or another. This review isn't to say those people are wrong for having their opinions, but rather a review to focus on what the game has to offer. Overwatch is full of great characters, lots of game modes including super fun workshop modes, unique art style and more. You can choose to play casually or try to climb rank and understand the game on a more nuance level. Through out the years I've enjoyed different phases of the game that have kept me consistently playing. Playing the different roles offers a nice change of pace and also helps learn how teams work together. The game isn't perfect, but no game is. Some think the game changes too much, others think the changes happen too slow. The shop to buy skins is expensive in my opinion, but have you ever heard of this game Valorant? No one seems to care about those insane prices. If you ask me about the core game and what the bulk of Overwatch game play is, I can only say I enjoy it and recommend you try if you haven't. This review is meant to look at the game itself subjectively to see it for what it IS and not what it ISN'T. Also I'm tired of all the politics in gaming these days. Simply put, a game of Overwatch is fun, period.
